sn55.9:1: Sitting to one side, the Venerable Ānanda said to the Blessed One:
sn55.9:2: "Ānanda, the bhikkhu Asoka who has died, by the destruction of the taints, in this very life had entered and dwelt in the taintless liberation of mind, liberation by wisdom, realizing it for himself with direct knowledge. …all the rest as in the preceding sutta…
sn55.9:3: "This, Ānanda, is that Dhamma exposition, the mirror of the Dhamma, equipped with which a noble disciple, if he wishes, could by himself declare of himself: ‘I am one finished with hell. … I am a stream-enterer, no longer bound to the nether world, fixed in destiny, with enlightenment as my destination.’"
